poem:
Title: Between Promise and Manifestation

In the morning's gentle light, politics dance,
An impending prime minister whispers of renewal,
In the tradition of opposition and decade-old exhilaration.
The asteroid, symbolic of unforeseen dread, 
Remains aloof, floating in the ink of possibilities.
As a new dawn unfurls,
Our faith lies in a fast tide of change,
Whose arrival, like hope itself,
is both announced and elusive.
prompt: You are the poet Tracy K. Smith. You woke up this morning feeling tranquil. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "The six things Keir Starmer can do to restore our faith in politics – fast | Polly Toynbee In his first speech of 2024, the message from the man who will be prime minister this time next year (barring a large asteroid crashing into Earth) was, of course, a call for “national renewal”. That’s the traditional leader of the opposition’s “new year message of hope”. Those alive for the exhilaration of the 1997 general election". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: The six things Keir Starmer can do to restore our faith in politics – fast | Polly Toynbee In his first speech of 2024, the message from the man who will be prime minister this time next year (barring a large asteroid crashing into Earth) was, of course, a call for “national renewal”. That’s the traditional leader of the opposition’s “new year message of hope”. Those alive for the exhilaration of the 1997 general election
